title: Too Late
lyrics:
I dreamt of you
The last two nights
And we made love
Like our past lives
Felt good to see 
Your face again

And feel your sun

Under my skin

We kissed goodbye in Brooklyn light

Then things got darker after that night

I know I tainted what we had

How could something so good end so bad

Don't get it twisted I'm not asking for forgiveness

I'm just saying I would do things a little different



And now



It’s too late to say I’m sorry

Too messed up to say I love you

We’ve moved on years passed but

Sometimes I miss us

It’s too late to say I’m sorry

Too messed up to say I love you

We’ve moved on years passed but

Sometimes I miss us



And you saw all I would be, I would be, I would be, I would be

I would be, I would be, I would be, I would be



I'd love to sit down

And clear things up up

Maybe talk about music

That could be enough

But what would that do

For you now 

Cause you got a wife

And a child

Don't get it twisted I'm not asking for forgiveness

I'm just saying I would do things a little different



And now



It’s too late to say I’m sorry

Too messed up to say I love you

We’ve moved on years passed but

Sometimes I miss us

It’s too late to say I’m sorry

Too messed up to say I love you

We’ve moved on years passed but

Sometimes I miss us



And you saw all I would be, I would be, I would be, I would be

I would be, I would be, I would be, I would be





Might have been the one

Now you’re someone else

Know that you told me

No one would love me

Or treat me the way you do

I refused to believe you

Strangers on my pillow

And I’m thinking of you

Still thinking of you



And now it’s



It’s too late to say I’m sorry

Too messed up to say I love you

We’ve moved on years passed but

Sometimes I miss us

It’s too late to say I’m sorry

Too messed up to say I love you

We’ve moved on years passed but

Sometimes I miss us



I miss us
